claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.

verified_evidence.quote: After vaccination, in both age groups, the two egg based vaccines generally reinforced the neutralizing antibody responses to egg adapted epitopes as evidenced by an increased trend in the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4. In contrast, among RIV4 and ccIIV4 recipients, the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4 was significantly lower, suggesting that non egg based vaccines induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 5 of the document, with only minor differences in wording but identical factual content. The relevant passage is: 'After vaccination, in both age groups, the two egg based vaccines generally reinforced the neutralizing antibody responses to egg adapted epi to pes as evidenced by an increased trend in the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4. In contrast, among RIV4 and ccIIV4 recipients, the proportion of participants with GMT egg cell titer ratio ≥4 was significantly lower, suggesting that non egg based vaccines induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses.' This matches the quote to verify in all substantive details.. The quote directly supports the claim. It states that non-egg-based vaccines (including recombinant RIV4) induced a broader antibody response to both egg and cell propagated viruses, as opposed to egg-based vaccines, which reinforced a narrower, egg-adapted response. This broader response is relevant to the claim that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season. The quote provides explicit comparative immunogenicity data supporting the claim.

This broader response is relevant to the claim that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season. The quote provides explicit comparative immunogenicity data supporting the claim.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote directly compares the immune response profiles, showing that recombinant (and cell-based) vaccines avoid the narrow, egg-adapted response and instead induce broader immunity, which is relevant for cross-protection in mismatch seasons.

verified_evidence.quote: The potential of non egg based vaccines to mitigate the impact of prior egg based vaccination remains unclear. In this study, repeat vaccination with either RIV4 or ccIIV4 further improved antibody responses to circulating viruses compared to repeated egg based vaccination.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears in the document, though with minor formatting and word order differences due to OCR cleanup. This matches the quoted content in meaning and technical detail, specifically stating that repeat vaccination with recombinant (RIV4) or cell-based (ccIIV4) vaccines improved antibody responses to circulating viruses compared to repeated egg-based vaccination.. The quote directly supports the claim. It states that repeat vaccination with recombinant (RIV4) or cell-based (ccIIV4) vaccines 'further improved antibody responses to circulating viruses compared to repeated egg based vaccination.' This is explicit evidence that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season, as it shows improved responses to circulating (potentially mismatched) viruses.

verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote provides direct evidence that recombinant (and cell-based) vaccines enhance immune responses to circulating (i.e., potentially mismatched) viruses, supporting the claim of broader and cross-protective immunity.

new_evidence.quote: In year 1, RIV4 induced higher neutralizing and total HA head binding antibodies to cell- A (H3 N2) virus than ccIIV4 and IIV4.
new_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote shows that the recombinant vaccine (RIV4) generated higher levels of neutralizing and binding antibodies to the cell-propagated (wild-type-like) H3N2 virus, supporting the claim that recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, especially in seasons where the circulating virus differs from the egg-adapted vaccine strain.

new_evidence.quote: RIV4 contains 3 times the i d 45 HA/d / ...d IIV4 and ccIIV4 (15 µg HA/dose/strain). For A (H3 N2), RIV4 vaccination not only improved the quality of the functional neutralizing antibody ... it also significantly increased the quantity of the total A (H3 N2) cell HA head binding antibodies (Fig. 4 A, Fig. S1 A).
new_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote indicates that the recombinant vaccine (RIV4) not only improved the quality but also the quantity of antibodies against the cell-propagated H3N2 virus, which is more representative of circulating strains, thus supporting a broader and potentially cross-protective immune response.
